creditline: Lent by Carol and Jeffrey Horvitz
description: spattered glaze evenly covers smooth, curved surface, which particially seperates at the upper third of the sculpture, creating a cap-like piece at the top that is curved along its bottom edge, and angled along the top
text: Fujino Sachiko is one of a growing group of women artists who have begun to enjoy success in the traditionally male-dominated field of Japanese ceramics. Her works often feature subtly textured and colored surfaces-the result of applying clay slip with an airbrush. This sensitivity to delicate surfaces harkens back to her training as a fashion designer and fabric dyer.
title: Woman
